properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 11 at 4:03PM EST until February 12 at 4:15AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has extended
the

* Flood Advisory for...
West central Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North
Carolina...
Southeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina...

* Until 415 AM EST Wednesday.

* At 358 PM EST, High flows and elevated lake levels continued along
the Catawba River reservoir chain. As a result of excess water
passed though each lake, the pool height at Mountain Island Lake
remained above full pool. This was causing nuisance shoreline
flooding and flooding of lake-access areas, docks, and residential
yards. High flows are also causing rises and nuisance flooding of
residential yards just downstream of the dam along the Catawba
River.

* For Mountain Island Lake, at 101.5 feet, typical impacts include
nuisance flooding of low-lying areas including residential yards,
docks, and boat-launch areas.  Flooding of residential yards
downstream of Mountain Island Dam along Riverhaven Dr, Hart Rd,
Lake Dr, and Riverside Dr is occurring.

* Residents should take immediate actions to protect property
adjacent to Mountain Island Lake and the Catawba River, closely
monitor lake levels for sudden changes, and follow guidance from
Charlotte-Mecklenburg Emergency Management. Drivers are encouraged
to heed any barricades and avoid all flooded areas.

* For more information on lake levels or dam releases, people are
encouraged to visit http://lakes.duke-energy.com, call 1-800-829-
5253, or download the Duke Energy Lake View mobile app.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or
ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
